#summary Human Spinal Cervical Nerves
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanNerves] -> [HumanNervesSpinalCervical]
----

This page is intended to list all nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />

Coverage verified by:
  * http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/nerve (name base)
  * http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves (MA reference)

= CERVICAL NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS =

  * *Upper Cervical Ventral Spinal Roots*; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_MM Medial Motor Nucleus,BMA.SC.VH.MM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_NECK Neck,TARGET.TEA.NECK]}
   * *C1 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne58.htm C1 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branch to rectus lateralis, muscular branch to rectus capitis anterior, muscular branch to longus capitis, branch to vagus nerve, superior root of ansa cervicalis}; DISTRIBUTION={moves forward lateral to the lateral mass and medial to vertebral artery}
   * *C2 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne59.htm C2 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branch to sternocleidomastoid, muscular branch to longus capitis and longus colli, inferior root of ansa cervicalis}
   * *C3 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne60.htm C3 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Branch to form levator scapulae, muscular branch to trapezius, muscular branch to longus capitis, longus colli and scalenus medius, inferior root of ansa cervicalis, root to phrenic nerve}
   * *C4 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne61.htm C4 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Muscular branch to trapezius, muscular branch to levator scapulae, muscular branch to longus colli}
   * <img src="http://www.stayfitbug.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/strong_neck_muscles.jpg">
  * *Lower Cervical Ventral Spinal Roots*; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_MM Medial Motor Nucleus,BMA.SC.VH.MM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_HAND Hand,TARGET.TEA.HAND]}
   * *C5 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne62.htm C5 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Brachial plexus, dorsal scapular nerve, muscular branch to scalene muscles, branch to long thoracic nerve, branch to phrenic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={sensory lateral - skin after piercing the trapezius and the splenius; sensory medial - longissimus, cervicis, longissimus capitis, and iliocostalis cervicis; motor - leads into the upper trunk, then to the lateral cord, and finally to the musculocutaneous nerve}
   * *C6 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne63.htm C6 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Brachial plexus, branch to scalene muscles, long thoracic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={innervating many muscles of the rotator cuff and distal arm - subclavius, supraspinatus, infraspinatus, biceps brachii, brachialis, deltoid, teres minor, brachioradialis, serratus anterior, subscapularis, pectoralis major, coracobrachialis, teres major, supinator, extensor carpi radialis brevis, extensor carpi radialis longus, latissimus dorsi}
   * *C7 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne64.htm C7 NERVE]); BRANCHES={Brachial plexus, branch to scalene muscles, to long thoracic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={musculocutaneous nerve, ulnar nerve, radial nerve}
   * *C8 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne65.htm C8 NERVE]); BRANCHES={To scalene muscles, to long thoracic nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin on the little finger, slightly past the wrist on the palmar and dorsal aspects of the hand and forearm; flexion of the fingers, many mucles of trunk, upper arm, forearm, hand}
   * <img src="http://apbrwww5.apsu.edu/thompsonj/Anatomy%20&%20Physiology/2010/2010%20Exam%20Reviews/Exam%204%20Review/13-09ac_BrachPlxus.JPG">

    * *great auricular nerve, posterior branch*; ORIGIN={C3}; DISTRIBUTION={ear; posterior branch supplies the skin over the mastoid process, back of the auricle, lobule and a portion of the scalp}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG_C3 C3 Dorsal Root Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.DRG.C3] -> [BrainRegionBMA_HM_CU Cuneate Nucleus,BMA.HM.CU]; GVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa,BMA.SC.PH.SG] -> [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VP Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus,SMA.FD.TH.VPL]}

   * *occipital nerve*; MODALITY={general sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_FACE Face,TARGET.TEA.FACE] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG_C2 C2 Dorsal Root Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.DRG.C2],[BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_DRG_C3 C3 Dorsal Root Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.DRG.C3] -> [BrainRegionBMA_HM_CU Cuneate Nucleus,BMA.HM.CU]; GVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_FACE Face,TARGET.TEA.FACE] -> [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa,BMA.SC.PH.SG] -> [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VP Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus,SMA.FD.TH.VPL]}
    * *occipital nerve, greater* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/greateroccipitalnerve.htm GREATER OCCIPITAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={medial branch of dorsal branch of C2}; BRANCHES={Muscualr branches, cutaneous branches}; DISTRIBUTION={semispinal muscle of head and skin of scalp as far forward as the vertex}
    * *occipital nerve, lesser* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/lesseroccipital.htm LESSER OCCIPITAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={superficial cervical PLEXUS (C2-C3)}; DISTRIBUTION={ascends behind the auricle and supplies some of the skin on the side of the head and on the cranial surface of the auricle}; MODALITY={general sensory}
    * *occipital nerve, third* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/thirdoccipital.htm THIRD OCCIPITAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={medial branch of dorsal branch of C3}; DISTRIBUTION={skin of upper part of back of neck and head}; MODALITY={general sensory}

= HEART AND LUNG CERVICAL NERVES =

  * *Motor and Sensory (Ventral Spinal Roots and Dorsal Spinal Roots)*
   * *phrenic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/leftphrenicnerve.htm LEFT PHRENIC NERVE], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/rightphrenicnerve.htm RIGHT PHRENIC NERVE]); ORIGIN={cervical PLEXUS (C3-C5)}; BRANCHES={pericardiac and phrenicoabdominal branches}; DISTRIBUTION={pleura, pericardium, diaphragm, peritoneum, and sympathetic plexuses; sensory - central tendon of the diaphragm}; MODALITY={general sensory and motor}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionBMA_SC_VH_MM Medial Motor Nucleus,BMA.SC.VH.MM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_LUNG Lung,TARGET.TEA.LUNG]; GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_LUNG Lung,TARGET.TEA.LUNG] -> [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa,BMA.SC.PH.SG] -> [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VP Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus,SMA.FD.TH.VPL]}
    * *phrenic nerves, accessory* an inconstant contribution of the fifth cervical nerve to the phrenic nerve; when present, they run a separate course to the root of the neck or into the thorax before joining the phrenic nerve}
    * <img src="http://www.medicalartlibrary.com/respiratory/images/diaphragm-phrenic-nerve.jpg">
  * *Sensory (Dorsal Spinal Roots)*
   * *cervical cardiac nerve, sensory*; MODALITY={general sensory}; MODALITY={visceral afferent (chiefly pain)}; FIBERS={GVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_HEART Heart,TARGET.TEA.HEART] -> [BrainRegionBMA_SC_PH_SG Substantia Gelatinosa,BMA.SC.PH.SG] -> [BrainRegionSMA_FD_TH_VP Ventral Posterolateral Nucleus,SMA.FD.TH.VPL]}
    * *cervical cardiac nerve, middle, sensory* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne303.htm LEFT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne314.htm RIGHT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION]); ORIGIN={sensory fibers whose cell bodies are placed in the C5-6 spinal ganglia through the thoracic splanchnic nerves}; DISTRIBUTION={heart}
    * *cervical cardiac nerve, inferior, sensory* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne286.htm CARDIAC BRANCH OF CERVICOTHORACIC GANGLION]); ORIGIN={sensory fibers whose cell bodies are placed in the C7-8,T1 spinal ganglia through the thoracic splanchnic nerves}; DISTRIBUTION={heart via cardiac PLEXUS}
    * <img src="http://www.merckmanuals.com/media/home/figures/NEU_referred_pain.gif">
